intro: Agoseris lacera, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent red stamens, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
